rulebook.text:
SYMBOLS SHOWN IN THIS LEGEND ARE TYPICAL ALL SYMBOLS MAY NOT APPLY TO
THIS PROJECT.
MOUNTING HEIGHT, UON, IS TO BOTTOM OF THE EQUIPMENT.
TQMINIMIZE SOUND TRANSMISSION, DO NOT INSTALL "BACK-TO-BACK’ OUTLET

MECHANICAL EQUIPMENT INDICATED ON SHEETS WITH E. EG, EL AND EP PREFIXES
ARE SHOWN IN APPROXIMATE LOCATIONS. FOR EXACT LOCATIONS OF THE
MECHANICAL EQUIPMENT AND PIPING, SEE MECHANICAL DRAWINGS. PROVIDE
DISCONNECT SWITCHES, BY NATIONAL ELECTRICAL CODE (NEC) EVEN WHEN
NOT INDICATED ON ELECTRICAL DRAWINGS.

COORDINATE LOCATIONS AND MOUNTING HEIGHTS OF LIGHTING FIXTURES IN
MECHANICAL AND ELECTRICAL ROOMS WITH FINAL LOCATIONS OF PIPES, DUCTS
AND OTHER EQUIPMENT FOR THE BEST ARRANGEMENT. FIXTURES SHALL BE
EASILY ACCESSIBLE FOR RELAMPING. PENDANT LENGTHS INDICATED ARE
ESTIMATES AND THE ACTUAL PENDANT LENGTH REQUIRED SHALL BE
DETERMINED/PROVIDED BASED ON FIELD COORDINATION WITH INSTALLED
EQUPMENT.

CONDUCTOR AND CONDUIT SIZES ARE BASED ON COPPER CONDUCTORS WITH TW
INSULATION IN EMT CONDUIT, UON.

ALLWIRING SHALL BE CONCEALED IN FINISHED AREAS, UON ON ELECTRICAL
SHEETS.

PANEL DIRECTORIES POSTED WITHIN THE PANELS SHALL BE REVISED AS NEEDED
‘TO REFLECT FINAL AS-SUILT INSTALLATION CONDITIONS.

SEAL PENETRATIONS THROUGH ROOFS, CEILINGS, FLOORS, WALLS AND RE
WALLS TO MAINTAIN THE INTEGRITY OF AIR BARRIER, FIRE AND ACOUSTIC RATINGS
OF THE ROOF, CEILINGS, WALLS AND FLOORS.

COMPONENTS WHICH CONSTITUTE AN ELECTRICAL SYSTEM SHALL BE FULLY
COMPATIBLE WITH ONE ANOTHER AND SHALL BE APPROVED BY THE VARIOUS
MANUFACTURERS FOR USE WITH ALL THE OTHER COMPONENTS WITHIN THE
SYSTEM (ONE EXAMPLE OF AN ELECTRICAL SYSTEM IS THE BUILDING LIGHTING
SYSTEM COMPRISED OF FIXTURES, LAMPS, SWITCHES, BALLASTS, OCCUPANCY
SENSORS AND DIMMING EQUIPMENT).

PROVIDE NAMEPLATES ON EXTERIOR OF ALL ELECTRICAL PANELS AND
ENCLOSURES AS FOLLOWS: DEVICE ID, DEVICE RATING, POWER SOURCE. FOR
DISCONNECT SWITCHES AND MOTOR STARTERS THE DEVICE ID SHALL BE THE
UNIQUE IDENTIFIER OF THE EQUIPMENT BEING FED BY THE SWITCHISTARTER.

PROVIDE SEPARATE NEUTRALS FOR GACH CIRCUIT UTILIZING A NEUTRAL
CONDUCTOR (D0 NOT COMBINE NEUTRALS. DO NOT UTILIZE MULTIWIRE BRANCH
GRCUTTS).

THE INTERRUPTING CURRENT (AL.C.) RATING OF THE PANELBOARD AND
ELECTRICAL EQUIPMENT SHALL BE INCREASED TO THE NEXT HIGHER.
COMMERCIALLY AVAILABLE RATING WHERE THERE IS NOT A COMMERCIAL RATING
‘THAT IS EQUAL TO THE EQUIPMENTS INDICATED ALC. RATING.

RACEWAYS CROSSING STRUCTURAL EXPANSION JOINTS OR SEISMIC JOINTS
SHALL BE PROVIDED WITH SUITABLE EXPANSION FITTINGS OR OTHER MEANS TO
COMPENSATE FOR BUILDING EXPANSION AND CONTRACTION, SEISMIC MOVEMENT,
AND TO PROVIDE FOR CONTINUITY OF GROUNDING.

RECEPTACLES THAT ARE INDICATED TO HAVE GFCI PROTECTION SHALL BE WIRED
SUCH THAT LOSS OF POWER ON ONE RECEPTACLE DOES NOT AFFECT THE
DOWNSTREAM RECEPTACLES, UON.

CAST OUTLET AND JUNCTION BOXES SHALL BE PROVIDED WITH THREADED
FITTINGS AND COVERS THAT FIT FLUSH WITH THE EDGES OF OUTLET BOXES.

OUTLETS, SWITCH. JUNCTION, ETC. BOXES MOUNTED INSIDE THE WALL WITH ONLY
FACE PLATE OR DEVICE SURFACE DESIGNED FOR EXPOSURE IS OUTSIDE WALL
SURFACE.

PROHIBIT SURFACE MOUNTED CONDUIT, RACEWAY, OR WIRES ON EXTERIOR OR
INTERIOR SURFACES OF WALLS, FLOORS, ROOFS AND CEILINGS. ROOM
EXCEPTIONS: MECHANICAL ELECTRICAL AND TELECOMMUNICATIONS ROOM.
SURFACE EXCEPTION: EXPOSED METAL DECK CEILINGS.

WHEN CONDUIT IS RAN UNDER PANDECK, CONTRACTOR SHALL PROVIDE
STRUCTURED CABLE SUPPORTS WITH 4 INCHES OR MORE OF SEPARATION OR
RIGID STEEL CONDUIT TO AVOID PENETRATIONS FROM DECK SCREWS OR OTHER
PENETRATIONS.

RECEPTACLES THAT ARE CONNECTED TO UPS'GENERATORS SHALL BE PROVIDED
WITH AN ORANGE DEVICE COVER PLATE TO BE READILY IDENTFIED.

UON, ALL 20 AMP BRANCH CIRCUITS WILL COMPRISE (1) 314” CONDUIT, (1,2. OR 3 AR)
#12 AWG UNGROUNDED CONDUCTORS, (1 AR) #12 GROUNDED CONDUCTOR, AND
(1) #12 AWG EGC.

FOR ANY 20 AMP BRANCH CIRCUIT RUN THAT IS LONGER THAN 100 FEET OR ANY 30
AMP BRANCH CIRCUIT RUN THAT IS LONGER THAN 150 FEET, INCREASE THE
CONDUCTOR SIZES AT LEAST ONE AWG SIZE TO REDUCE VOLTAGE DROP.

CONTRACTOR IS AUTHORIZED TO COMBINE MULTIPLE CIRCUITS IN COMMON
RACEWAY AS DESIRED, PROVIDED THAT CONDUCTOR AMPACITIES DO NOT DROP
BELOW THE OVERCURRENT PROTECTION DEVICE SETTINGS, AFTER
CORRECTIONS AND ADJUSTMENT FACTORS ARE APPLIED PER NEC 310.15.

SHOP DRAWINGS SHALL BE APPROVED BY COR BEFORE THE START OF ANY
CONSTRUCTION.
